L10–15 (Entry): Listens first; asks for help readily; accepts guidance and corrects mistakes quickly.
L20–25 (Developing): Invites feedback; assumes positive intent; begins mentoring on small tasks while deferring complex decisions.
L30–35 (Career): Shows self‑awareness; balances confidence with deference; gives sincere praise and credits the team.
L40–45 (Advanced): Models humility across teams; handles critique well; shares lessons learned broadly.
L50–55 (Expert): Demonstrates executive presence without ego; amplifies others' contributions in cross‑org forums.
L60–65 (Principal): Sets the tone company‑wide; publicly owns missteps and course‑corrects; attracts followership through humility.

L10–15 (Entry): Delivers assigned tasks; makes personal sacrifices as needed; sustains a healthy pace.
L20–25 (Developing): Takes end‑to‑end responsibility for workstreams; improves personal productivity systems.
L30–35 (Career): Consistently meets commitments across diverse scope; removes blockers proactively.
L50–55 (Expert): variable factors; maintains reliability under ambiguity; coordinates others' efforts.
L60–65 (Principal): Sustains high output on significant/unique issues; sets team cadence and standards.
column8: Drives critical initiatives that impact future concepts/products; maintains pace across multi‑org missions.

L10–15 (Entry): Rapidly learns HC tools and policies; applies them to routine issues.
L20–25 (Developing): Develops professional expertise; seeks diverse perspectives to solve a variety of issues.
L30–35 (Career): Shows full understanding of specialization; evaluates data factors to select methods creatively.
L40–45 (Advanced): Deepens breadth; chooses techniques under ambiguity; learns from cross‑domain peers.
L50–55 (Expert): Possesses broad/unique knowledge; contributes to company principles and objectives; learns at org level.
L60–65 (Principal): Develops resolutions to critical/broad design matters; shapes learning agendas company‑wide.

L10–15 (Entry): Focus on high quality within well‑defined tasks; builds stable internal relationships.
L20–25 (Developing): Produces dependable work; expands scope to moderate complexity; starts external collaboration.
L30–35 (Career): Delivers at journey‑level quality across diverse scope; networks with senior personnel in area.
L40–45 (Advanced): Achieves excellence on complex issues; sets evaluation criteria; networks outside area of expertise.
L50–55 (Expert): Sets standards on significant/unique issues; formal networks across groups; represents HC externally.
L60–65 (Principal): Defines "world‑class" bar for the company; external spokesperson for the organization.

L10–15 (Entry): Shares status truthfully; delivers the same message in different settings; responds to feedback openly.
L20–25 (Developing): Surfaces risks to the team; asks for help early; documents decisions clearly.
L30–35 (Career): Communicates trade‑offs and assumptions; invites dissent to improve decisions.
L40–45 (Advanced): Makes tough calls visible; aligns stakeholders across teams through honest updates.
L50–55 (Expert): Transparent about strategic constraints; builds trust across org/clients through candid narratives.
L60–65 (Principal): Sets transparency norms; encourages courageous feedback at all levels; maintains one version of truth.

L10–15 (Entry): Fixes small problems rather than assigning blame; adopts team retros.
L20–25 (Developing): Suggests process tweaks; closes feedback loops on moderate scope issues.
L30–35 (Career): Leads improvement on diverse scope; selects methods/techniques to obtain better results.
L40–45 (Advanced): Defines evaluation criteria; implements corrective actions across complex systems.
L50–55 (Expert): Creates formal networks to drive cross‑group improvements; scales practices.
L60–65 (Principal): Sets company‑level improvement agenda tied to future concepts/technologies.

L10–15 (Entry): Treats teammates as colleagues; demonstrates empathy and service; recognizes every individual's value.
L20–25 (Developing): Builds productive relationships internally/externally; resolves issues with care.
L30–35 (Career): Navigates diverse stakeholders respectfully; credits others in complex deliverables.
L40–45 (Advanced): Maintains respect under high ambiguity; bridges differences across functions.
L60–65 (Principal): respectful networks among groups and clients.
column8: Embeds respect in company rituals; is a role model for empathy and service at scale.

L10–15 (Entry): Owns assigned tasks; meets expectations with detailed instruction; learns to close the loop.
L20–25 (Developing): Owns small workstreams; exercises judgment within defined practices; delivers end‑to‑end on routine projects.
L30–35 (Career): Owns deliverables across diverse scope; chooses methods; mentors junior teammates.
L40–45 (Advanced): Owns outcomes across complex initiatives; coordinates others; sets methods and procedures.
L50–55 (Expert): Owns cross‑org outcomes; exercises independent judgment on special assignments; may supervise others.
L60–65 (Principal): Owns mission‑critical objectives; exercises wide latitude; aligns organizational efforts to strategic aims.
